title: LEGCO QUESTION NO.10 (Written Reply)
question_text: Question : Regarding single-parent families in receipt of Comprehensive Social Security Assistance, will the Government inform this Council: (a) of the number of such families caused by divorce; (b) of the number of such families which should receive maintenance, and the average amount of maintenance they receive each month; and Asked by: Dr Hon LAW Chi-kwong Date of meeting : 7 July 1999 Replied by : Secretary for Health and Welfare   Question : Regarding

single-parent families in receipt of Comprehensive Social Security Assistance, will the Government inform this Council: (a) of the number of such families caused by divorce; (b) of the number of such families which should receive maintenance, and the average amount of maintenance they receive each month; and (c) whether it knows the number of families which did not receive full payment of maintenance on schedule in the past year? Please give a breakdown by the following percentages of the maintenance received:
(i) below 24%;
reply_text:
Madam President, (a) Based on an internal
study conducted by Social Welfare Department (SWD), it is estimated that 6 100 single
parent families in receipt of Comprehensive Social Security Assistance (CSSA) are divorced
cases. Furthermore, 7 800 single parent families in receipt of CSSA are separated
cases. These two groups represent 24.4% and 31.2% of all single parent cases receiving
CSSA payments. (b) SWD do not have any
record of the number of such families who have been ruled by the court to be eligible for
maintenance payment.
